com.hdcookbook.grin
Class Feature

java.lang.Object
  com.hdcookbook.grin.Feature
All Implemented Interfaces:
SetupClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
Assembly, Box, FixedImage, Group, ImageSequence, Modifier, Text, Timer, Translation, Translator
public abstract class Feature
extends java.lang.Object
implements SetupClient

Represents a feature. A feature is a thing that presents some sort of UI. A phase presents some number of features, and features can be shared between phases.

Author:
Bill Foote (http://jovial.com)

Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns:
the name of this feature

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a developer-friendly description of this feature, for debugging

getStartX

public abstract int getStartX()
Give the x coordinate of the upper-left hand corner of this feature's bounding box at frame 0 of any translations it might contain.

getStartY

public abstract int getStartY()
Give the y coordinate of the upper-left hand corner of this feature's bounding box at frame 0 of any translations it might contain.

initialize

public abstract void initialize()
Initialize this feature. This is called on show initialization. A show will initialize all of its features after it initializes the phases.

destroy

public abstract void destroy()
Free any resources held by this feature. It is the opposite of setup; each call to setup() shall be balanced by a call to unsetup(), and they shall *not* be nested.

It's possible an active phase may be destroyed. For example, the last phase a show is in when the show is destroyed will probably be active (and it will probably be an empty phase too!).

setSetupMode

protected abstract void setSetupMode(boolean mode)
Change the setup mode of this feature. The new mode will always be different than the old.

setActivateMode

protected abstract void setActivateMode(boolean mode)
Change the activated mode of this feature. The new mode will always be different than the old.

doSomeSetup

public abstract void doSomeSetup()
Do some setup work. This is called from the SetupManager thread, and is where time-consuming setup (like image loading) should happen.

Specified by:
doSomeSetup in interface SetupClient

needsMoreSetup

public abstract boolean needsMoreSetup()
This is where the feaure says whether or not it needs more setup. Calls to this are synchronized within the init manager to avoid race conditions. The implementation of this method must not call outside code or call any animation manager methods.

Specified by:
needsMoreSetup in interface SetupClient

setup

public boolean setup()
Called by the show when it's time to begin setting up this feature. This can be called multiple times; each call will eventually be matched by a call to unsetup().

Returns:
true if this call started setup being done
See Also:
unsetup()

unsetup

public void unsetup()
Called by the show when this feature is no longer needed by whatever contains it. When the last call to setup() has been matched by a call to unsetup(), it's time to unload this feature's assets.

See Also:
setup()

activate

public final void activate()
Called by the show when this feature becomes activated, that is, when it starts presenting. These nest, so this can be called mutliple times. When the last call to activate() is undone by a call to deactivate(), that means this feature is no longer being shown.

See Also:
deactivate()

deactivate

public final void deactivate()
Called by the show when this feature is no longer being presented by whatever contains it.

See Also:
activate()

sendFeatureSetup

protected void sendFeatureSetup()
When a feature finishes its setup, it should call this to tell the show about it. This happens in the setup thread.

addDisplayArea

public abstract void addDisplayArea(java.awt.Rectangle area)
Deprecated. This will probably go away once transition to the animation framework is complete

Request to add the visible area of this feature to the given rectantle.

Parameters:
area - The current area, or a rectangle with a width of 0 to mean "nothing visible so far".

paintFrame

public abstract void paintFrame(java.awt.Graphics2D gr)
Paint the current state of this feature to gr

Parameters:
gr - The place to paint to.

advanceToFrame

public abstract void advanceToFrame(int newFrame)
Called from Segment with the Show lock held, to advance us to the state we should be in for the given frame.

Parameters:
newFrame - The frame number we're up to in our presentation.
